## Corporation.nextCycle() method

Sleep until the start of the next Corporation cycle.

**Signature:**

```typescript
nextCycle(): Promise<CorpStateName>;
```
**Returns:**

Promise&lt;[CorpStateName](./bitburner.corpstatename.md)<!-- -->&gt;

{<!-- -->Promise<CorpStateName>} Resolves to the name of the next state to be processed. I.e. when the state is PURCHASE, it means purchasing will occur during the next state transition. Possible states are START, PURCHASE, PRODUCTION, EXPORT, SALE.

## Remarks

RAM cost: 1 GB

The amount of real time spent asleep between cycles can vary due to "bonus time".
